001package interfaces;
002
003/**
004 *
005 * @author Marat Dukhan
006 */
007public interface RandomNumberGenerator {
008        /**
009         * Generates a random int.
010         * @return A random int between Integer.MIN_VALUE (inclusive) and Integer.MAX_VALUE (inclusive).
011         */
012        public int nextInt();
013
014        /**
015         * Generates a random double in range [0, 1).
016         * @return A random double between 0 (including) and 1 (excluding).
017         */
018        public double nextUniform();
019
020        /**
021         * Generates a random double in range [a, b).
022         * @param a The lower bound of a support of the generated random variable. a must be no greater than b.
023         * @param b The upper bound of a support of the generated random variable. b must be no less than a.
024         * @return A random double between a (including) and 1 (excluding).
025         */
026        public double nextUniform(double a, double b);
027
028        /**
029         * Generates a normal variable with zero mean and unit variance.
030         * @return A standard normal random variable.
031         */
032        public double nextNormal();
033
034        /**
035         * Generates a normal variable with specified mean and standard deviation.
036         * @param mu The mean of the generated random variable.
037         * @param sigma The standard deviation of the generated random variable. Must be greater than 0.
038         * @return A normal random variable with mean mu and standard deviation sigma.
039         */
040        public double nextNormal(double mu, double sigma);
041
042        /**
043         * Generates a log-normal random variable with specified shape and log-scale parameter.
044         * @param mu The log-scale parameter. mu is the mean of the natural logarithm of the generated random variable.
045         * @param sigma The shape parameter. sigma is the standard deviation of the natural logarithm of the generated random variable. sigma must be greater than 0.
046         * @return A log-normal random variable with log-scale parameter mu and shape parameter sigma.
047         */
048        public double nextLogNormal(double mu, double sigma);
049
050        /**
051         * Generates a gamma random variable with specified shape and rate parameters.
052         * @param alpha The shape parameter of the gamma distribution. alpha must be greater than 0.
053         * @param beta The rate parameter of the gamma distribution. beta must be greater than 0.
054         * @return A gamma variable with shape parameter alpha and rate parameter beta.
055         */
056        public double nextGamma(double alpha, double beta);
057
058        /**
059         * Generates a Student-t random variable with specified degrees-of-freedom parameter.
060         * @param nu The degrees-of-freedom parameter. Must be greater than 0.
061         * @return A Student-t random variable with nu degrees of freedom.
062         */
063        public double nextStudentT(double nu);
064
065        /**
066         * Generates an exponential random variable with scale parameter mu.
067         * @param mu Scale parameter. The mean of the random variable to be generated equals mu. mu must be greater than 0.
068         * @return An exponential random variable with scale parameter mu.
069         */
070        public double nextExponential(double mu);
071
072        /**
073         * Generates an chi-squared random variable with the number of degrees-of-freedom nu.
074         * @param nu The degrees-of-freedom parameter. Must be greater than 0.
075         * @return A chi-squared random variable with nu degrees of freedom.
076         */
077        public double nextChiSquared(double nu);
078
079        /**
080         * Generates a Poisson random variable with the specified mean and variance.
081         * @param lambda The mean and variance of the Poisson distribution. Must be greater than 0.
082         * @return A Poisson random variable with mean and variance lambda.
083         */
084        public long nextPoisson(double lambda);
085}
